messages.subject: Re: Strange Phone call
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 02/20/2002 10:15:05 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... I ve gotten this. I had this bizarre conversation with one woman who just didn t get it.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 02/20/2002 10:15:05 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I'm a county contact through one of the California homeschooling
> organizations, so I get a lot of "new homeschooler" calls.
>
> I just got one from a woman looking for someone else to "homeschool" her
> kids. I tried to convince her that what she was seeking was a small, and
> perhaps home-based, private school, but she was very insistent that she
> wanted them homeschooled... just not, apparently, in HER home by her!
>
> I think I'm freaked out. <weak g> None of you just called to mess with my
> head, right? <gg>
>
>

I've gotten this. I had this bizarre conversation with one woman who just
didn't get it.

Her: I want to register my daughter for the homeschooling.
Me: (Explains homeschooling)
H: No, I want to sign her up.
Me: (Explains again, more slowly, easier words)
H: You mean WE have to do it????!! Well, that certainly doesn't sound good.
I wouldn't like that at all.

Perhaps for these children school is a good idea...it gets them away from
their parents.

Kathryn



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
